p: Interestingly, endemic yellow fever has never been reported in Asia, Madagascar or other Indian Ocean islands, for reasons that are still poorly understood. Primates (monkeys and humans) from these regions are susceptible, and Ae. aegypti and other experimentally competent Aedes mosquitoes are present there [ 26, 27, 28]. Importantly, Haemagogus sp. and Sabethes sp. are absent from Africa, the Indian Ocean and Asia.
